fact_check_explanation_title: Joe Rogan podcast uses Covid-19 death data out of context
fact_check_explanation_summary: The UKHSA explained these figures are to be expected, because a larger proportion of the population are vaccinated than unvaccinated.

fact_check_explanation_title: BBC presenter corrects false claim about Owen Paterson vote
fact_check_explanation_summary: BBC Breakfast presenter Charlie Stayt claimed a vote on whether to suspend Owen Paterson for breaches of the MPs Code of Conduct was a ‘free vote’. It wasn’t. It was …

fact_check_explanation_title: Did the French PM really ask for the EU to ‘punish’ the UK over Brexit?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims the French PM wrote to the EU President asking the EU to punish the UK for Brexit have been controversial. We look at what his letter actually said.

fact_check_explanation_title: 293 ‘daily’ Covid deaths likely cover more than one day after technical issue
fact_check_explanation_summary: 293 Covid-19 deaths were reported on 2 November, in part because a technical issue meant death recording was delayed over the weekend.
A picture of a chicken from Morrisons has gone viral for packaging stating the salt and pepper used are “non-EU”. Morrisons says this is to comply with legal requirements, not …

fact_check_explanation_title: Spiking: Very rare to contract HIV through used needle
fact_check_explanation_summary: The National AIDS Trust said some posts claiming victims of needle spiking had tested positive for HIV were “demonstrably false”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines do offer some protection against transmission and infection
fact_check_explanation_summary: Neil Oliver recently incorrectly said that Covid-19 vaccines don’t offer any protection against transmission or infection from the virus.

fact_check_explanation_title: Was the Chancellor right on the Budget increasing departmental spending by the most this century?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Chancellor announced departmental spending during this Parliament would increase by the largest amount this century. Our calculations show spending increased more each year from 2001-2005.

fact_check_explanation_title: What do we know so far about reports of ‘spiking’ with needles?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Police across the UK are investigating more than 50 reports of incidents involving some form of injection.

fact_check_explanation_title: Why can you mix and match booster jabs in pregnancy?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists are encouraging pregnant women to get the booster.

fact_check_explanation_title: False claims from funeral director about facemasks, vaccines and the pandemic
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared video on social media, featuring an interview with a funeral director contains false information about the Covid-19 pandemic.

fact_check_explanation_title: Claims of an EU mineral water ban need a drop of context
fact_check_explanation_summary: Manufacturers can continue to export to Britain, as long as they renew their accreditation by 7 January 2022.
